properties.name: 2012 Estuaries
properties.description: OBJECTID1276ID305BVAT-G15E_ELI03A08SQ_MILES3.44046285CYCLE2012STATEVAWATER_NAMEElizabeth River Mainstem - MouthLOCATIONFrom start BIBI segment ELIPHa (SE corner Craney Isl. line to east) downstream to mouth (NE corner Craney Isl. east to S Glenwood Pk). BIB segment ELIPHa. CBP segment ELIPH. DSS (ADMIN) condemnation # 056-007 A (effective 20090518).AU_COMMENTSClass II, Section 1b, a, z. The Aquatic Life Use - Estuarine Bioassessment impairment based on failure to meet a statistical evaluation constituting an un-impacted benthic organism population per CBP (Benthic-IBI) analysis. The Elizabeth River mainstem segment BIBI-ELIPHa was assessed as impaired of the Clean Water Act's Aquatic Life Use Support Goal due to the results of benthic BIBI probabilistic station surveys. The BIBI stressor tool yielded "unknown" as the probable impairment source. This segment was previously included (2006 IR) in TMDL ID: VAT-G15E-01-03. The Aquatic Life and Open-Water Aquatic Life Use is impaired based on failure to meet the dissolved oxygen criteria for Open Water - Summer. The Aquatic Life and Open-Water Aquatic Life Use for Rest of Year (ROY) is assessed as insufficient information - previously listed under EPA's 1998 303(d) Overlisting as impaired. The mainstem Elizabeth River was included in EPA's 1998 303(d) Overlisting as impaired of the Aquatic Life Use; the impairment was attributed to excessive nutrients. During the 2006 cycle, the revised Chesapeake Bay water quality standards were adopted. EPA approved Chesapeake Bay TMDL 12/29/2010. The Fish Consumption Use is impaired based on the VDH fish consumption advisory for PCBs issued 12/13/04 due to polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) in fish tissue. The advisory recommends that adults eat no more than two meals/month of croaker, gizzard shad, and spot. High risk individuals such as women who are pregnant or may become pregnant, nursing mothers, and young children are advised not to eat any fish contaminated with PCBs. Also exhibits Observed Effects due to the VDH (issued 1988) caution to limit consumption of fish on a daily basis due to the potential for Kepone fish tissue contamination, reported in historical fish monitoring data with the potential for presence in the sediments of the James River. The Wildlife Use is fully supported based on NHx data from the DEQ station 2-ELI002.00. The Recreation Use is fully supported based on Enterococcus bacteria data (0 viol. / 70 obs.) from the station 2-ELI002.00. Shellfishing Use Removed due to the DSS Administrative-Condemnation # 056-007 A (effective 20090518) Segment added for 2008 IR (split from 2006 IR segment ELI02A06) to match BIBI segment ELIPHa boundary. 1999 CD segment for nutrients (Attachment A, Category 1, Part 2) VAT-G15E-01-03. 1999 CD segment for Tributyltin (Attachment A, Category 1, Part 1) VAT-G15E. DEQ (AQM) monitoring stations @ 2-ELI002.00. Numerous (BIBI) benthic probabilistic monitoring stations. IMP_CAUSEEstuarine Bioassessments, Dissolved Oxygen, PCB in Fish TissueSOURCEAtmospheric Deposition - Nitrogen, Industrial Point Source Discharge, Internal Nutrient Recycling, Loss of Riparian Habitat, Municipal Point Source Discharges, Wet Weather Discharges (Point Source and Combination of Stormwater, SSO or CSO), Source UnknowCATEGORY5DAQUA_LIFENot SupportingDEEP_CHANNNot ApplicableDEEP_WATERNot ApplicableFISH_CONSUNot SupportingMIGRATORYNot ApplicableOPEN_WATERNot SupportingPWSNot ApplicableRECREATIONFully SupportingSW_SAVNot ApplicableSHELLFISHNot ApplicableWILDLIFEFully SupportingSHAPE.AREA13961992.2029793SHAPE.LEN20493.7293555374]]>
